page.title: 14Trade - Local shopping.
page.content: While the prices charged in Windermere shops reflect the influence of tourism, especially in the summer, there has not been the growth in the number of shops which could be called "tourist-orientated" that there has been in nearby Bowness. Apart from the new Tourist Information Bureau near the station, there are only 2 shops which sell local'gifts' out of the 70 or so shops in the village. The eleven cafes/restaurants, more than might be expected, depend a great deal on the tourist trade however, and most close in the winter. 20% of the shops sell food and banks and building societies are well represented. A random selection of the others includes 3 solicitors, launderette, 2 bakers, 4 antique shops, 2 shops selling kitchen equipment, a wine shop, a Boots and a Smiths.
